bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Eduardo Angles, November 27, 1941

div1.p: Hench sends Angles a reprint of his yellow fever article, and hopes Angles will see it as the beginning of efforts to publicize the work of Finlay among Americans.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Eduardo Angles, November 27, 1941
div1.opener:
November 27, 1941
Dr. Eduardo Angles
#19 General Lee Street
Marianao
Havana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Angles:
div1.p:
I am sending to you with my best wishes a reprint of an
address I gave last June when Walter Reed's daughter unveiled in Cleve-
land a painting dedicated to The Conquerors of Yellow Fever. In this
painting Dr. Carlos Finlay, your great compatriot, holds a high and
honored place. In my address I tried to cover considerable ground
in a short space and could give all too brief mention of the great
work of Dr. Finlay, but I plan to continue my investigations on the
history of the conquest of yellow fever and hope to publish in the
future a detailed account.

I hope you and your colleagues will see in this painting
and in this address at least a beginning--a step in the direction of
giving due honor to Dr. Finlay. We in America need to know more about
him and in turn we want our Cuban friends to know more of Reed and his
colleagues. Together they splendidly served humanity.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
